spending_level_1.summary: This category encompasses all social policy expenditures, including services managed by the Integration Joint Board (IJB) and non-IJB services. It includes adult social care, services for the elderly, children's services, child protection, foster care, adoption services, support for people with disabilities, and other health and social care services.

spending_level_2.summary: Expenditures related to adult social care, services for the elderly, and health and social care services managed in partnership with the West Lothian Integration Joint Board. This includes home care, residential care, support for adults with disabilities, and mental health services.

spending_level_3.summary: Provision of care services to adults and the elderly in their own homes.
Services related to care homes and supported living facilities for adults and the elderly.
Support services for adults with physical or learning disabilities.
Community and residential services for individuals with mental health needs.

spending_level_2.summary: Expenditures on children's social care services, including child protection, foster care, adoption services, youth justice, and services for children with disabilities.

spending_level_3.summary: Services aimed at safeguarding children from abuse and neglect.
Recruitment, training, and support for foster carers and adoptive parents.
Programs to prevent youth offending and support rehabilitation.
Support for children with physical or learning disabilities.

spending_level_1.summary: This category encompasses all spending related to educational services provided by the council, including staffing costs for teachers and support staff, educational materials, school maintenance, and administrative support.

spending_level_2.summary: Educational services for primary school students, including teaching staff and school operations.
Educational services for secondary school students, including teaching staff and school operations.
Provision of early childhood education and childcare services for children under the age of five.
Support services for students with additional learning needs.
Includes educational psychology, curriculum development, and administrative support.
Additional funding allocated directly to schools to reduce the poverty-related attainment gap.
Supports Gaelic language education within the council area.
National program aimed at improving educational outcomes in areas of deprivation.

spending_level_1.summary: Costs associated with corporate management functions, including the Chief Executive's office, financial management, property services, human resources, IT services, and administrative support.

spending_level_2.summary: Overall strategic leadership and governance of the council.
Financial management, budgeting, accounting, and treasury services.
Management and maintenance of the council's property portfolio (excluding housing).
Provision and maintenance of information technology infrastructure and support.
Recruitment, training, employee relations, and payroll services.
Legal advice and support across the council's operations.
Managing the acquisition of goods and services.

spending_level_1.summary: This includes expenditures on essential day-to-day services such as roads and transportation, waste management, environmental health, street cleaning, parks and open spaces, and fleet services.

spending_level_2.summary: Maintenance of roads, bridges, and transportation infrastructure.
Refuse collection, recycling services, and waste disposal.
Food safety, pollution control, and public health services.
Cleaning and maintenance of public spaces.
Maintenance of parks, playgrounds, and recreational areas.
Management of the council's vehicles and equipment.

spending_level_1.summary: Costs related to the management and maintenance of the council's housing stock, including repairs, housing management, rent collection, and housing support services for tenants.

spending_level_2.summary: Upkeep and repair of council-owned housing properties.
Housing management services including rent collection and tenancy management.
Accounting for the value and depreciation of housing assets.
Provision for rent arrears and uncollectible debts.
Other costs related to housing services.

spending_level_1.summary: This category includes various services not classified elsewhere, such as cultural services, community development, library services, and support for voluntary organizations. It also includes the operational costs of West Lothian Leisure Ltd.

spending_level_2.summary: Libraries, museums, arts programs, and community development initiatives.
Health promotion, disease prevention, and health education.
Management of commercial properties to support local businesses.
Preparedness and response planning for emergencies and disasters.
Costs associated with democratic representation and management.
Operational costs of providing leisure services, including sports facilities, swimming pools, fitness centers, and recreational programs.
